api/FileFormat.Slides.Examples.ImageExam.title: Class ImageExamples | FileFormat.Slides
api/FileFormat.Slides.Examples.ImageExam.keywords: Class ImageExamples Namespace FileFormat.Slides.Examples Assembly FileFormat.Slides.Examples.dll Provides C# code examples for creating, reading, and modifying Presentation images using the FileFormat.Slides library. public class ImageExamples Inheritance object ImageExamples Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors ImageExamples() Initializes a new instance of the ImageExamples class. Prepares the directory 'Presentations/Image' for storing or loading PowerPoint(PPT or PPTX) presentations at the root of the project. If the directory doesn't exist, it is created. If it already exists, existing files are deleted, and the directory is cleaned up. Prepares the directory 'Presentations/Existing/Images' to store images to be added to the presentations. public ImageExamples() Methods AddImageInASlide(string, string, string) This method adds up an image in a slide public void AddImageInASlide(string documentDirectory = "../../../Presentations/New", string filename = "test.pptx", string imagename = "sample.jpg") Parameters documentDirectory string Path of the presentation folder filename string Presentation name imagename string Picture or image name RemoveImageInExistingSlide(string, string) This method removes the image from presentation public void RemoveImageInExistingSlide(string documentDirectory = "../../../Presentations/Existing", string filename = "test.pptx") Parameters documentDirectory string Path of presentation folder filename string Presentation name UpdateImageInExistingSlide(string, string, double, double) This method updates the existing image of a slide public void UpdateImageInExistingSlide(string documentDirectory = "../../../Presentations/Existing", string filename = "test.pptx", double xAxis = 0, double yAxis = 0) Parameters documentDirectory string Path of presentation folder filename string Presentation name xAxis double xAxis value in double yAxis double xAxis value in double

api/FileFormat.Slides.Examples.SlideExam.title: Class SlideExamples | FileFormat.Slides
api/FileFormat.Slides.Examples.SlideExam.keywords: Class SlideExamples Namespace FileFormat.Slides.Examples Assembly FileFormat.Slides.Examples.dll Provides C# code examples for creating, reading, and modifying slides in a Presentation using the FileFormat.Slides library. public class SlideExamples Inheritance object SlideExamples Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors SlideExamples() Initializes a new instance of the SlideExamples class. Prepares the directory 'Presentations/New' for storing or loading PowerPoint(PPT or PPTX) presentations at the root of the project. If the directory doesn't exist, it is created. If it already exists, existing files are deleted, and the directory is cleaned up. public SlideExamples() Methods CreateNewSlideInExistingPresentation(string, string) This method creates new slide in an existing presentation public void CreateNewSlideInExistingPresentation(string documentDirectory = "../../../Presentations/Existing", string filename = "test.pptx") Parameters documentDirectory string Path of the presentation folder filename string Presentation name CreateNewSlideInNewPresentation(string, string) This method create slides in a new presentation public void CreateNewSlideInNewPresentation(string documentDirectory = "../../../Presentations/New", string filename = "test.pptx") Parameters documentDirectory string Path of the presentation folder filename string Presentation name RemoveSlideInAnExistingPresentation(string, string) This method removes slide in an existing presentation public void RemoveSlideInAnExistingPresentation(string documentDirectory = "../../../Presentations/Existing", string filename = "test.pptx") Parameters documentDirectory string Path of the presentation folder filename string Presentation name

api/FileFormat.Slides.Examples.html.title: Namespace FileFormat.Slides.Examples | FileFormat.Slides
api/FileFormat.Slides.Examples.html.keywords: Namespace FileFormat.Slides.Examples Classes ImageExamples Provides C# code examples for creating, reading, and modifying Presentation images using the FileFormat.Slides library. SlideExamples Provides C# code examples for creating, reading, and modifying slides in a Presentation using the FileFormat.Slides library. TextExamples Provides C# code examples for creating, reading, and modifying Text segments or shapes in a Presentation using the FileFormat.Slides library.

docs/index.html.title: Learning Resources | FileFormat.Slides
docs/index.html.keywords: Learning Resources FileFormat.Slides for .NET FileFormat.Slides for .NET is an API to work with Microsoft PowerPoint presentations in your C# / ASP.NET / VB.NET projects. Below are relevant resources: Source Code Docs and API References Nuget Package FileFormat.Slides.Examples FileFormat.Slides.Examples are examples to demonstrate Microsoft PowerPoint presentations manipulation using FileFormat.Slides for .NET. Below are relevant resources: Source Code Docs and API References Nuget Package ##Contact Us Create an issue on any of the GitHub projects OR create a topic in our forum: FileFormat Forum Other Resources Product Pages Blogs Docs

index.html.title: C# Slides API - FileFormat.Slides.Example Docs | FileFormat.Slides
index.html.keywords: C# Slides API - FileFormat.Slides.Example Docs Explore the Examples Welcome to the homepage of FileFormat.Slides.Examples project. This project represents comprehensive code examples to manipulate PowerPoint presentations (PPT, PPTX) using FileFormat.Slides for .NET API. Please go through the package source code and adjust the code to suit your particular requirements. API Reference C# Examples to use FileFormat.Slides for .NET API have been created in the form of an API. Click below to explore examples API Reference: API Reference Articles Please click below article to explore more learning resources: Articles
